title: Police: Englewood burglaries target homes, houses of worships
content:
CHICAGO (WLS) -- 
A rash of burglaries in Englewood have been reported in the last couple of weeks, targeting homes and houses of worship, according to Chicago police. 
Police released a community alert about six burglaries reported since Aug. 25; one in the 7000-block of South Union Avenue, one in the 7200-block of South Halsted Street, one in the 700-block of West 71st Street and three in the 700-block of West 73rd Street. The burglaries took place at all hours of the day and night, including in the middle of the day. 

 
Police say the burglar or burglars gain entry through a window or through the front or rear door by force. They say various household items have bene taken. Police also say that houses of worship have been targeted; in one burglary alarm system wiring was cut and a different burglary an industrial-size air conditioner was taken. 
Police describe the offender or offenders as black males, 18-22 years old, 5 ft. to 5 ft. 3 in. and between 100 and 150 lbs. with their hair in braids or dreadlocks. 

If you have any information about these burglaries, contact Area South detectives at 312-747-8273.
